com.buabook.kdb.connection

Class KdbConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.buabook.kdb.connection.KdbConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    KdbConsumer, KdbPublisher

    public class KdbConnection
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable

    KDB Connection Wrapper

    Class provides connect / disconnect / reconnect functionality on top of the default c class.

    NOTE: By default this class exposes no send / receive functionality. This is left up to extension classes to provide these features.

    (c) 2014 - 2015 Sport Trades Ltd
    Since:
    27 Apr 2014
    Version:
    1.0.1
    Author:
    Jas Rajasansir

    • Constructor Detail

      • KdbConnection

        public KdbConnection(KdbProcess process)
        Creates a new kdb connection object with the reconnection interval set as the default (as defined by DEFAULT_RECONNECT_INTERVAL_MS. NOTE: Calling this constructor will not initiate the connection. This must be done manually by calling connect().
        Parameters:
        process - The kdb process to connect to
        See Also:
        KdbConnection(KdbProcess, Integer)

      • KdbConnection

        public KdbConnection(KdbProcess process,
                     Integer reconnectIntervalMs)
        Creates a new kdb connection object with the specified reconnection interval. NOTE: Calling this constructor will not initiate the connection. This must be done manually by calling connect().
        Parameters:
        process - The kdb process to connect to
        reconnectIntervalMs - The reconnect interval (in milliseconds) in case the connection is lost

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws KdbTargetProcessUnavailableException
        Performs the connection to the KDB process
        Throws:
        KdbTargetProcessUnavailableException - If the target KDB process is unavailable
        See Also:
        reconnect()

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects from the KDB process (by closing the underlying socket)

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns:
        False if either the connection object or the connection Socket is null. NOTE: These are the only two circumstances where false will be returned. True will be returned in all other cases.

      • getConnection

        public c getConnection()
        Returns:
        The current connection to the kdb process

      • getRemoteProcess

        public KdbProcess getRemoteProcess()
        Returns:
        The remote process that this connection object is connected to

      • reconnect

        public void reconnect()

        Provides the ability to reconnect to the target KDB process if necessary (generally after an IOException). Function will also force a disconnect of the underlying Socket, just to be sure.

        NOTE: This function will block in a retry loop if the kdb process is unavailable when attempting to connect.

        See Also:
        reconnectIntervalMs

      • close

        public void close()
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
